title: What Is the Difference Between Being Educated and Wise | Sri Sampati Dasa
speaker: HG Satya Gaura Chandra Dasa

segments.text: how to educate people how to earn property in the rightful manner ravan was also called brahmin
he was educated what did he do when he heard about the beauty of mother sita
he became lusty difference between being educated being wise
ramayan teaches an important lesson for all of us especially in the modern day
the difference between being educated being wise we find the example of ravan who was highly
educated who was called pandit ravan was called pandit
he is a son of a great sage called vishravas a brahmana sage vishravas and ravan was also
called brahmin right people say that he is brahmin the brahmin is the one who knows the vedas who has
got a lot of knowledge but unfortunately even though he was a pandit he was son of a brahmana
sage vishravas he was not a wise person he had so much of arrogance he was lusty he was greedy
he was arrogant
when he heard about the beauty of mother sita he became lusty and he went to kidnap mother sita who
was married was happily living with her husband shri ram but he went and kidnapped her his
education didn't help him and he was educated what did he do he went and snatched lanka from
his half brother kubera so he was power hungry he wanted property of lanka and he was hungry
so he was not satisfied his education didn't teach him how to be satisfied his education didn't teach
him how to earn property in the rightful manner in a wrong way he snatched property from his own
brother kubera he went and kidnapped a married woman because he was lusty so but he was highly
educated on the other hand we see the great personality lord shri ram who was also educated
but more than educated he was a wise person the moment he was asked to choose between ayodhya and
going to forest he happily chose to go to forest and gave up ayodhya to his own brother bharat in
fact in ramayana we see when bharat was ready to offer ayodhya back to ram ram was very happy
being in the forest he wanted bharat to continue to be the king and take care of ayodhya till he returns
so ram was very satisfied with what was there in his life he was not an ambitious over ambitious
person like ravan who was ready to snatch property from his own brother here ram is happily handing
over ayodhya to his own brother bharat and ram even though shurpanaka came and offered herself
ram did not become lusty he had control over himself he used his wisdom he used his power
his knowledge to have control over himself to follow the promise given to his own wife that
ekapatni vratasta when a woman a beautiful woman coming and offering herself with her own consent
let's have fun ram said no i cannot i i would like to follow my promise and i'm not interested
in this but ravan became lusty ram exhibited self-control so we need wise people not just
knowledge of the world but knowledge of the world and knowledge of the world and knowledge of the
people not educated people in today's society we are all talking about how to educate people
but ramayana teaches us mere education is not enough we have to make people wise and they
become wise when they develop character like lord shri ram not like ravan if you are only
concerned about education not character building then we will have a lot of
educated characterless people like ravan like we hear many times when the police arrest some of
the terrorists some of the terrorists happen to be highly educated like double degree like medical
they have done their mbps they have done their masters in some engineering field and they they
have become terrorists so we need people like lord shri ram and shri ram teaches us the importance
of wisdom importance of knowledge of knowledge of knowledge of knowledge of knowledge of knowledge of
importance of character along with education that is the lesson we learn from shri valmiki ramayana
